messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] New York
messages.msgSnippet: ... (snip) ... I m going to email Liza off-list about all this NYC stuff, but just in case anyone was confused, no, it s not a homeschooling conference.  It s
messages.messageBody:
1/17/03 00:13:

>> Aha!  Liza lives in NYC.  I knew somebody on this list did.  I have a
>> NYC
>> question.

(snip)

> Is it a homeschooling conference? Which one?

I'm going to email Liza off-list about all this NYC stuff, but just in case
anyone was confused, no, it's not a homeschooling conference. It's American
String Teachers Association, which is my professional organization. 3 days
of string players talking jargon. Sounds great, to me, at least....


brenda

messages.subject: Re: New York
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m unlurking(?) for a minute to say hi!  I grew up in Jamestown. Actually Fluvanna. My family lived there from 1976-1981.  I still have a soft spot for
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., Dawn Bennink <dbennink@n...> wrote:
> Yes - I'm VERY western NY - Jamestown. Hi, neighbor!
> Dawn
>
I'm unlurking(?) for a minute to say hi! I grew up in Jamestown.
Actually Fluvanna. My family lived there from 1976-1981. I still
have a soft spot for that part of the country. Its really pretty
around there.
How are the laws around there? Do you have to jump through many
hoops? Are there any support groups? I have a friend who still
lives in Jamestown and would like to suggest homeschooling to her and
it would be nice to have the inside scoop. Feel free to e-mail me
privately if you'd rather. Djuana

messages.subject: New York
messages.msgSnippet: Yes - I m VERY western NY - Jamestown.  Hi, neighbor! Dawn
messages.messageBody:
Yes - I'm VERY western NY - Jamestown. Hi, neighbor!
Dawn

mary krzyzanowski wrote:

> Hi Dawn,
> Do you live in WNY? I'm near Rochester.
> Mary
